bill.title: Forensic Medical Evidence Process Improvements
bill.description: Concerning measures to provide additional access to services for victims of sexual assault, and, in connection therewith, making an appropriation.

history.action: Introduced In House - Assigned to Judiciary
House Committee on Judiciary Refer Amended to Appropriations
House Committee on Appropriations Refer Unamended to House Committee of the Whole
House Second Reading Special Order - Passed with Amendments - Committee, Floor
House Third Reading Passed - No Amendments
Introduced In Senate - Assigned to Judiciary
Senate Committee on Judiciary Refer Amended to Appropriations
Senate Committee on Appropriations Refer Amended - Consent Calendar to Senate Committee of the Whole
Senate Second Reading Special Order - Passed with Amendments - Committee
Senate Third Reading Passed - No Amendments
House Considered Senate Amendments - Result was to Laid Over Daily
House Considered Senate Amendments - Result was to Concur - Repass
Signed by the Speaker of the House
Signed by the President of the Senate

votes.desc: House Judiciary: Refer House Bill 23-1199, as amended, to the Committee on Appropriations.
House Appropriations: Refer House Bill 23-1199 to the Committee of the Whole.
Senate Judiciary: Adopt amendment L.004 (Attachment D)
Senate Appropriations: Refer House Bill 23-1199, as amended, to the Committee of the Whole and with a recommendation that it be placed on the consent calendar.
Senate Judiciary: Adopt amendment L.005 (Attachment E)
Senate Judiciary: Refer House Bill 23-1199, as amended, to the Committee on Appropriations.
